qas.question: What are the three types of transport in Nanjing?
What is the most popular method of travel for citizens?
How many bridges does Nanjing have over the Yangtze River?
How many tunnels does Nanjing have over the Yangtze River?
Where is the city centre located?

context: Nanjing is the transportation hub in eastern China and the downstream Yangtze River area. Different means of transportation constitute a three-dimensional transport system that includes <a0_0>land, water and air<a0_0/>. As in most other Chinese cities, <a1_0>public transportation<a1_0/> is the dominant mode of travel of the majority of the citizens. As of October 2014, Nanjing had <a2_0>five<a2_0/> bridges and <a3_0>two<a3_0/> tunnels over the Yangtze River, which are tying districts north of the river with the city centre <a4_0>on the south bank<a4_0/>.
